articles.author: Alexander Cornwell, Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israel's cabinet approved a deal with Palestinian militant group Hamas for a ceasefire and release of hostages in the Gaza Strip, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said on Saturday, a day ahead of the agreement's scheduled start.
articles.title: Israeli cabinet approves Gaza ceasefire accord, due to take effect Sunday

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Four people were killed early on Saturday in the centre of Kyiv in a night-time Russian attack, said Timur Tkachenko, head of the Ukrainian capital's military administration.
articles.title: Four dead in night-time Russian attack on Kyiv, military administration says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A case of mpox has been found in Azerbaijan, Interfax news agency reported on Saturday, adding that the patient had been isolated and was receiving treatment in hospital.
articles.title: First mpox case detected in Azerbaijan, Interfax reports

articles.author: Andrew Chung, John Kruzel
articles.description: The U.S. Supreme Court upheld on Friday a law banning TikTok in the United States on national security grounds if its Chinese parent company ByteDance does not sell the short-video app by Sunday, as the justices in a 9-0 decision declined to rescue a platform used by about half of all Americans.
articles.title: US Supreme Court upholds law banning TikTok

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The head of Taiwan's delegation to next week's inauguration of Donald Trump as U.S. president said on Saturday he was going there to extend the island's "highest blessings" to the United States.
articles.title: Taiwan delegation to take 'highest blessings' to Trump inauguration

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Yoon Suk Yeol,South Korea's impeached president, plans to attend a court hearing on Saturday to fight a request by investigators to extend his detention on accusations of insurrection, his lawyer said.
articles.title: South Korea's President Yoon to attend court hearing on extending detention

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Two senior Iranian Supreme Court judges involved in handling espionage and terrorism cases were shot dead in the capital Tehran on Saturday, Iran's judiciary said.
articles.title: Two Supreme Court judges shot dead in Tehran, Iranian judiciary says

articles.author: Subrata Nag Choudhary
articles.description: An Indian police volunteer was convicted on Saturday of the rape and murder of a junior doctor at a hospital in the eastern city Kolkata, in the speedy trial of a crime that sparked national outrage over a lack of safety for women.
articles.title: India police volunteer convicted of rape, murder of junior doctor in Kolkata

articles.author: Villen Anganan
articles.description: Mauritius Prime Minister Navin Ramgoolam has questioned the duration of the lease on a U.S.-British military base, he told a local newspaper, a contentious element of negotiations in which the UK plans to cede control of the Chagos Islands to Mauritius.
articles.title: Mauritius PM queries duration of lease deal for Chagos military base

articles.author: Ahmed Tolba, Menna AlaaElDin
articles.description: Naim Qassem's remarks were the first in public since Israel and Hamas reached the accord.
articles.title: Hezbollah chief says Gaza ceasefire deal shows 'persistence of resistance' against Israel
